title: Fabric Panel with Kebaya Design and Embroidery

 part)

  title_text: Fabric Panel with Kebaya Design and Embroidery

  preference: main

  creation_date: early-mid 20th century

  creation_place_original_location: Java (Indonesia)

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  materials_name: muslin

  techniques_name: sewing (needleworking technique) embroidering

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a panel of fabric. It holds a sketched design of a scalloped border with floral details. A segment of the fabric is embroidered with ivory thread.

  subject_terms_1: flowers (motifs) Peranakan unfinished kebayas embroidery (visual works)

  subject_terms_2: Motifs Peranakan (Asian people) Textiles Embroidery

  subject_terms_3: Peranakan costumes

  sgcool_label_text: This panel of muslin fabric shows a sketched design of scalloped border with floral details
 a segment of which has been embroidered with ivory coloured thread. This embroidered panel may have been intended for a kebaya with tapered ends. These kebayas were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.

This embroidered panel may have been intended for a kebaya with tapered ends. These kebayas were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
